Player History
Signed as a free agent by Toronto on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Traded from Toronto to Los Angeles on 2/14/1986 (Going to LAD: P Juan Berenguer, P Ron Davis, C Ernie Whitt, 1B Fred McGriff, 3B Mike Bordick. Going to TOR: P Rick Sutcliffe, C Mike Scioscia)...
Injured on 6/3/1986 with a Strained Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 6-7 weeks...
Had first career hit (homerun) on 8/10/1987, off Ted Power (CIN)...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1988...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1989, hitting .384 with 10 HR, 16 RBI...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/14/1989, hitting .636 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1989, hitting .426 with 7 HR, 33 RBI...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,714,286 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/5/1990, hitting .357 with 5 HR, 14 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against St. Louis on 7/6/1990...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/10/1990, hitting .429 with 1 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1990, hitting .315 with 8 HR, 26 RBI...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,714,286 through salary arbitration...
Was selected to the 1991 Allstar game...
2/2/1992: Gets a new one-year contract worth $5,157,143 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Los Angeles to Toronto on 5/18/1992 (Going to LAD: 2B Amaury Garcia, SS Lou Collier, 3B Mike Pagliarulo, P Heath Haynes. Going to TOR: 1B Fred McGriff, CF Chili Davis)...
6/1/1992: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $6,666,000 per year, for 4 years.
